svg:

* eXtreme Programming - Kent Beck* Agile Software Development - "Manifesto"* LEAN - Mary and Jane Popendieck* DEPLOYMENTS WERE: - BIG - SCARY - Dangerous"Enabling Technologies" - Containers ("Docker") (Open Container Initiative) - Kubernetes - Orchestration (Open Shift is our "brand" of Kubernetes) - CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment or Delivery)"Service Oriented Architecture" (SOA)"Universal API Gateway" - "Fundamental Challenges" - Team Autonomy (if your team OWNS a part of the business, you need to OWN it) - If a team owns a service they should be able to deploy new version of that service. whenever they need to WITHOUT coordination with upstream and downstreams users. - Coupling (Upstream and Downstream) User"Downstream""Upstream""Context Mapping""Feedback Loops" - CI/CD - Cybernetics - Norber Weiner - Human (real world) / Machine Interaction - Inner Feedback Loop - Everything before you push your code to CI pipeline. - Outer Feedback Loop - Everything after that. - the stuff that gets kicked back to you X(months|days|years) after you push it. - BRING AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE INTO OUR INNER LOOP
